Comment: A Manhattan jury has ruled that the New York Times is not liable for defaming Sarah Palin in a 2017 editorial that wrongly linked her to a 2011 mass shooting in Arizona. This verdict follows Palin's second lawsuit against the newspaper, after a previous trial in 2022 was dismissed due to jury errors. The case highlights the high bar for defamation suits involving public figures, with the Times defending its actions as an honest mistake.
